t: Isaiah 21
A Prophecy Against Babylon
A*p prophecy against the Desert by the Sea: Like*pn whirlwinds sweeping through the southland, an*ld invader comes from the desert, from*ld a land of terror.
A*pn dire vision has been shown to me: The*ld traitor betrays, the looter takes loot. Elam,*ln attack! Media, lay siege! I*ld will bring to an end all the groaning she caused.
At*pn this my body is racked with pain, pangs*ld seize me, like those of a woman in labor; I*ln am staggered by what I hear, I*ld am bewildered by what I see.
My*ln heart falters, fear*ld makes me tremble; the*ln twilight I longed for has*ld become a horror to me.
They*pn set the tables, they*ld spread the rugs, they*ld eat, they drink! Get*ln up, you officers, oil*ld the shields!
This*p is what the Lord says to me: “Go,*pn post a lookout and*ld have him report what he sees.
When*ln he sees chariots with*ld teams of horses, riders*ln on donkeys or*ld riders on camels, let*ln him be alert, fully*ld alert.”
And*p the lookout shouted, “Day*pn after day, my lord, I stand on the watchtower; every*ld night I stay at my post.
Look,*ln here comes a man in a chariot with*ld a team of horses. And*ln he gives back the answer: ‘Babylon*ld has fallen, has fallen! All*ln the images of its gods lie*ld shattered on the ground!’ ”
My*pn people who are crushed on the threshing floor, I*ld tell you what I have heard from*ln the Lord*s Almighty, from*ld the God of Israel.
A Prophecy Against Edom
A*p prophecy against Dumah: Someone*pn calls to me from Seir, “Watchman,*ld what is left of the night? Watchman,*ld what is left of the night?”
The*ln watchman replies, “Morning*ld is coming, but also the night. If*ln you would ask, then ask; and*ld come back yet again.”
A Prophecy Against Arabia
A*p prophecy against Arabia: You*pn caravans of Dedanites, who*ld camp in the thickets of Arabia,
bring*ld water for the thirsty; you*ln who live in Tema, bring*ld food for the fugitives.
They*ln flee from the sword, from*ld the drawn sword, from*ln the bent bow and*ld from the heat of battle.
This*p is what the Lord says to me: “Within one year, as a servant bound by contract would count it, all the splendor of Kedar will come to an end.
The survivors of the archers, the warriors of Kedar, will be few.” The Lord,*s the God of Israel, has spoken.
